CatDescriptText: Mrs. Evelyn Wright, 1076 Rivermont Drive, Glen-Hazel Heights, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 16, 1957, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that parents should be imprisoned for the unlawful acts of their children (under 18 years of age)?" answer reads: "No, because all you can do is to tell them and make them do while they are at home. But when they are away, they will do what they want to do."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Evelyn Wright wearing dark plush coat with single large button, standing with young girl wearing hair braid, plaid coat, and knitted mittens, on grassy lawn in front of hillside
